sentence.Network_en: The word Easter derives from Eostre, the pagan goddess of spring.
sentence.Network_cn: Easter（复活节）一词由Eostre（多神教的春天女神）衍生而来。

sentence.Network_en: The singing of Christmas carols is a custom derived from early dance routines of pagan origin.
sentence.Network_cn: 唱圣诞颂歌的风俗源自异教徒早期的舞蹈仪式。

sentence.Network_en: That pagan did not believe in Christ.
sentence.Network_cn: 那个异教徒从不相信基督。

蒲甘王朝建于十一世纪初，以蒲甘(Pagan)为首都。当时上自国王和贵族，下至平民百姓，为了行善积德建造了数万座大小不一的佛塔。

list.abs: it tends to assume the form of a pagan religious ceremony , adapting itself to the forms and the ritual ofthe local church .它则趋向采取一种异教徒的宗教礼仪的方式，并且使自已适应于地方教堂的各种礼节和仪式。
in 394 AD , the Christian Roman Emperor Theodosius abolished the , as pagan festivals .公元394年，基督教罗马皇帝狄奥多西将其视为异教徒的节日予以废除。

this is a continuance of the ancient pagan idea that the evergreen tree represents a celebration of the renewal of life at time of death , darkness and cold at the winter solstice .这是一个延续古老的异教思想的常绿树代表了庆祝在黑暗和寒冷的冬至重生。
He is a pagan ., 他是一个异教徒.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin paganus 'villager, rustic', from pagus 'country district'. Latin paganus also meant 'civilian', becoming, in Christian Latin, 'heathen' (i.e. one not enrolled in the army of Christ)

entry.def: Pagan beliefs and activities do not belong to any of the main religions of the world and take nature and a belief in many gods as a basis. They are older, or are believed to be older, than other religions.

entry.tran: 异教徒（旧时指不信奉基督教的人）
entry.def: In former times, pagans were people who did not believe in Christianity and who many Christians considered to be inferior people.

example.ex: The new religion was eager to convert the pagan world.
example.tran: 那种新宗教急于使异教徒皈依本教。

example.ex: ...female saints who took vows of virginity rather than submit to an undesired marriage with a pagan.
example.tran: 立誓独身也不愿屈服与异教徒结婚的女圣人
